The title refers to an essay from 1967 by the art critic Lucy Lippard , " Escape Attempts” ( or " Ausstiegsversuche” in its original German ) . In it , Ms. Lippard coined the phrase " Beyond Utopia” to describe the impulse toward individual liberty that had taken hold of artists since World War II . This was the age of Happenings , Fluxus and conceptual art — or what she called " concept - art . ” Ms. Lippard wrote admiringly of these movements’ efforts to free art from the marketplace ,

sent1: A renowned German artist , Beckmann , fled Germany after Hitler 's rise , later moving to Amsterdam , Paris , and finally New York before the war .
sent2: Before the war , Beckmann had been at the peak of his career . He was a prominent figure in Berlin’s art scene and widely admired for his skill as a draftsman and painter , for his self - confidence , and for his charismatic personality . His works were included in all the major exhibitions of modern art throughout Europe . But after Hitler came to power , Beckmann was branded a " degenerate artist . ” He was fired from his job teaching at the Frankfurt Städel School . And he was forbidden to paint or exhibit his work .

sent1: First visit to a wildlife refuge : vibrant birds , insects , turtles , frogs , snakes , salamanders . Buzzing bugs , not all harmful—some beneficial , especially native bees .
sent2: A few years ago , my husband and I were shopping for a Christmas tree at the local Home Depot . After we paid for it , the cashier asked if we wanted to donate money to support the planting of more trees . We gave her our money , but then realized that there was no need to plant new trees—all she needed to do was take our tree back outside . Our tree could have been replanted and grown again !

sent1: Justice Thomas received a $ 150,000 2008 loan with favorable terms ; lender forgave it six months later , records show .
sent2: The terms of the loan were not disclosed when Justice Thomas filled out financial forms for his Supreme Court confirmation hearings in 1991 . The senators who reviewed the documents said that if they had known about the loan , they might have voted differently on whether to confirm him .

sent1: Set in 1953 , " The Sweet East " portrays three sisters—two white , one Black—through nuanced performances by Arianda , Gray , and Soule , reflecting timeless American family dynamics .
sent2: " The Sweet East , ” a new play by Stephen Metcalfe , is set in a time and place that are no longer with us . It was the late 1960 s , when the world was still ruled by men who wore suits to work and didn’t leave their wives for younger women . It was also a time of relative innocence ; one character describes it as " a sweet east wind that blew across America . ” That wind has now changed into something darker and more destructive — an ill wind that blows nobody any good . sent2: Astrid Delgado first learned that she might have to work harder than her white classmates when she was in middle school and took an exam for a private high school . When the results came back , her father was upset to learn that his daughter had scored 90 percent or higher on all but one part of the test — where she got only 51 percent . The section asked students to choose words from a list that best described themselves . Ms. Delgado , who is now 23 , said she chose " shy” because it seemed like the right answer .
